com.github.restdriver.clientdriver.jetty

Interface ClientDriverJettyHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultClientDriverJettyHandler

    public interface ClientDriverJettyHandler
extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler
    Interface for classes which handle incoming HTTP requests in the Client Driver.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

        org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle.Listener

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClientDriverExpectation addExpectation(ClientDriverRequest request, ClientDriverResponse response)
      Add in a ClientDriverRequest/ClientDriverResponse pair.
      void checkForUnexpectedRequests()
      This method will throw a ClientDriverFailedExpectationException if there have been any unexpected requests.
      void checkForUnmatchedExpectations()
      This method will throw a ClientDriverFailedExpectationException if any expectations have not been met.
      void noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest()
      Should not fail fast on unexpected requests, but will fail later when running checkForUnexpectedRequests().
      void reset()
      Resets the expectations so the current ClientDriver instance can be reused.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler

        destroy, getServer, handle, setServer

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

        addLifeCycleListener, isFailed, isRunning, isStarted, isStarting, isStopped, isStopping, removeLifeCycleListener, start, stop

    • Method Detail

      • addExpectation

        ClientDriverExpectation addExpectation(ClientDriverRequest request,
                                     ClientDriverResponse response)
        Add in a ClientDriverRequest/ClientDriverResponse pair.
        Parameters:
        request - The expected request
        response - The response to serve to that request
        Returns:
        The added expectation

      • checkForUnexpectedRequests

        void checkForUnexpectedRequests()
        This method will throw a ClientDriverFailedExpectationException if there have been any unexpected requests.

      • checkForUnmatchedExpectations

        void checkForUnmatchedExpectations()
        This method will throw a ClientDriverFailedExpectationException if any expectations have not been met.

      • noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest

        void noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest()
        Should not fail fast on unexpected requests, but will fail later when running checkForUnexpectedRequests().

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the expectations so the current ClientDriver instance can be reused.
